3 Three-Month Maintenance

This section describes three-month maintenance items.

3.1 HM, FM, and LM Head Units

3.1.1 Cleaning and Replacing Air Filter

The air filters should generally be inspected about every three months, although this depends on the supply air condition and the operating time. If the air filter is contaminated slightly, it can be cleaned by using an air blow tool. Replacing the air filter is recommended when it can no longer be adequately cleaned by air blowing.

Step 1 Move the head unit.

1. Remove all items sensitive to magnetic

fields such as wristwatches and magnetic

ID cards.

2. Press the emergency stop button and

detach the feeder exchange carriage, then

open the machine safety cover.

3. Move the head unit to convenient position

to work.

4. Place a square cloth under the head unit.

Step 2 For HM head unit: Remove the baffle plate.

Remove the baffle plate shown in the figure

right using a Phillips screwdriver.

Step 2 Removing baffle plate

right using a Phillips screwdriver.

Step 2 Removing baffle plate

Path Image Removing baffle plate : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/ThreeMonth_Maintenance/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_3_3.1_3.1.1_Removing_baffle_plate.png

Step 3 Remove the filter cap.

Rotate the filter cap counterclockwise to

remove the it along with the air filter.

Step 3 Removing filter cap

Path Image Removing filter cap : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/ThreeMonth_Maintenance/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_3_3.1_3.1.1_Removing_filter_cap.png

Step 4 Clean the air filter.

When the air filter is only lightly contaminated,

clean it using an air blow tool and reuse it.

NOTE

If there are heavy dust deposits in the air filter or the air filter has discolored, replace it with a new one (KLW-M8527-00).

Step 4 Cleaning filter

Step 4 Cleaning filter

Path Image Cleaning filter : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/ThreeMonth_Maintenance/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_3_3.1_3.1.1_Cleaning_filter.png

Step 5 Attach the air filter.

1. Attach the air filter to the filter cap.

2. Place the air filter to its original position

and rotate it clockwise to fix it

NOTE

Check the gasket (KLW-M715B-00) condition when

attaching the air filter. If it is worn or distorted, replace it

with a new one.

Step 6 For HM head unit: Attach the baffle plate.

Attach the baffle plate to its original position

using a Phillips screwdriver.

Step 7 Remove the square cloth.

3.1.2 Checking Ejector Vacuum Level

In this section describes the checking of the ejector vacuum level of heads for HM/FM head unit. When it cannot reach the specified vacuum level, replacement of the ejector bit or the valve may be required.

Perform the replacement referring to “6.1.1 Replacing Ejector Bit”, “7.2.1 HM head unit: Replacing Valves”, “7.2.2 FM head unit: Replacing Valves”, or “7.2.3 LM head unit: Replacing Valves” in this chapter.

Here describes about HM head unit as an example.

1 Move the head unit to machine front  side.

1. Press the emergency button and detach the

feeder exchange carriage. Then open the

machine safety cover.

2. Move the head unit to convenient position

to work.

Step 2 Disconnect the air hoses.

Disconnect all the air hoses from the upper air

joints. Keep the lower joints being connected.

NOTE

The air hoses are attached to the holder located at the reverse side of head unit front cover. When disconnecting the air hoses, be careful not to drop off the hoses from

the holders.

the holders.

Step 2 Disconnecting air hoses

Path Image Disconnecting air hoses : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/ThreeMonth_Maintenance/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_3_3.1_3.1.2_Disconnecting_air_hoses.png

Step 3 Check the vacuum level of each head.

1. Open the [unit] > [head] tab screen.

2. Select any head unit at the “Select Table”

field.

3. Press the [Vacuum] button of all heads.

4. Close the air joint part with finger.

5. The vacuum level of sealed head will

appear at the “Maximum value” field

located at the center of screen.

Check if the value is “190” or more, which is

the measuring reference value for sealed

condition.

NOTE

When the measured value cannot reach the measuring reference value, recheck the air path (ejector/valve) of the head and clean or replace it as necessary.

Step 3 Checking vacuum level

Step 3 Checking vacuum level

Path Image Checking vacuum level : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/ThreeMonth_Maintenance/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_3_3.1_3.1.2_Checking_vacuum_level.png

Step 4 Attach the air hoses to their original position.

CAUTION

Insert the air hoses all the way seated and confirm that they do not drop off.

3.1.3 Checking Operation of Each Valve of Head

This section describes how to check the operation of the blow valve and how to clean the blow valve of

HM, FM, and LM head units. The head unit has two types of valves, one is the blow valve blowing by each shingle head, and the other is the cleaning blow valve blowing powerfully to clean up inside of shaft. If the valve motion error occurs, the valve needs to be replaced. See “7.2.1 HM head unit: Replacing Valves”, “7.2.2 FM head unit: Replacing Valves”, and “7.2.3 LM head unit: Replacing Valves” in this chapter.

Here describes about HM head unit as an example.

CAUTION

The cleaning blow exhausts powerful air. The nozzle attached to the head should be detached when performing the cleaning blow. If the cleaning blow is performed with the nozzle attached, the nozzle may drop off from head and may be damaged or lost.

Step 1 Detach all the nozzles from the heads.

When nozzle station is equipped.

1. Open the [unit] > [head] tab screen.

2. Select any head unit from “Table Select”.

Step 5 Operate the cleaning blow valve.

1. Open the [unit] > [I/O] tab screen.

2. Select “head” from the pull-down list of the

“Output” side.

3. Select the address of cleaning blow valve.

Address for the cleaning valve

Table A : T1301704

Table B : T2301704

When an address is selected, the contents

of the selected address will appear at lower

left of screen, so check it.

NOTE

Address for the cleaning valve of FM head unit

Table A : T1300717

Table B : T2300717

4. Recheck that all the nozzles of target head

unit are detached.

5. Press the [ON/OFF] button once and the

cleaning blow valve operates.

(Address changes 0 to 1)

CAUTION

Recheck that all the nozzles attached to the target head

unit are detached before operating the cleaning blow

valve. If the cleaning blow is performed with the nozzle

attached, the nozzle may drop off from head and may be

damaged or lost.

attached, the nozzle may drop off from head and may be

Step 6 Check the condition of cleaning blow valve.

1. Check that the more powerful air is

exhausted from all the head than that

checked before by placing your hand

beneath the each head.

2. Press the [ON/OFF] button at the [unit] >

[I/O] screen again. The displayed address

will change from 1 to 0 and the cleaning

blow valves will close.

3. Check that the air exhausted from head

decreases.

When the air exhausted from the head does

not change even the cleaning blow valves are

operated, the replacement of cleaning blow

valve is required.

See “7.2.1 HM head unit: Replacing Valves”,

“7.2.2 FM head unit: Replacing Valves”, and

“7.2.3 LM head unit: Replacing Valves” in this

chapter to replace the valve.

CAUTION

“7.2.3 LM head unit: Replacing Valves” in this

chapter to replace the valve.

CAUTION

Be sure to wear the protective goggles as the cleaning blow air may blow on your face.

Step 7 Stop the blowing operation.

Press the [Blow] buttons of all the head at the

[unit] > [head] tab screen to stop the blowing

operation.

Step 8 Return the nozzles to their original position.

Return the nozzles to their original positions

on the head. If the nozzles have been detached

from the nozzle station, return them to the

original storage positions of the nozzle station.

3.1.4 Checking Shaft Tips

The shaft tip of the HM, FM, and LM heads may get dirty due to the long-term use, so that they should be inspected periodically.

Here describes about HM head unit as an example.

Step 1 Detach all the nozzles from head.

When nozzle station is equipped

1. Open the [unit] > [head] tab screen.

2. Select any head unit from “Table Select”.

3. Press the [nozzle Change] button.

4. Select “ALL” for “head Number” and select

“Store nozzle” for “nozzle Type” on the

“nozzle Change” screen.

5. Press the [OK] button to return all nozzles

to the nozzle station.

NOTE

For a machine equipped with a nozzle station, when

detaching the nozzles, make sure to detach them

automatically by pressing the [nozzle Change] button on

the [unit] > [head] tab screen.

NOTE

For a machine not equipped with a nozzle station, open

the machine safety cover and detach the nozzles by hand.

Step 1 Storing nozzle (for machine with nozzle station)

Step 1 Storing nozzle (for machine with nozzle station)

Step 2 Move the head unit to machine front side.

1. Press the emergency stop button and

detach the feeder exchange carriage.

2. Open the machine safety cover and move

the head unit to convenient position to

work.

Step 3 Check the shaft tips.

Check the shaft tips visually for all the heads

using a hand mirror or the similar.

TIP

When the shaft tips are soiled, clean them up referring to

“5.1.2 Cleaning Shaft Tip” described below in this chapter.

Step 3 Checking shaft tips

Path Image Checking shaft tips HM : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/ThreeMonth_Maintenance/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_3_3.1_3.1.4_Checking_shaft_tips_hm.png

Path Image Checking shaft tips FM : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/ThreeMonth_Maintenance/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_3_3.1_3.1.4_Checking_shaft_tips_fm.png

Path Image Checking shaft tips LM : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/ThreeMonth_Maintenance/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_3_3.1_3.1.4_Checking_shaft_tips_lm.png

Step 4 Return the nozzles to their original positions.

Return the nozzles to their original positions

on the head. If the nozzles have been detached

from the nozzle station, return them to the

original storage positions of the nozzle station.

3.2 HM Head Unit

3.2.1 Checking Spline Shaft Z-Axis Operation

This section describes how to check the operation of spline shaft Z-axis of HM head.

Step 1 Move the head unit.

1. Press the emergency stop button and

detach the feeder exchange carriage

2. Open the machine safety cover and move

the head unit to convenient position to

work.

Step 2 Move up and down the spline shaft Z-axis.

Press down the bottom of joint block of the

spline shaft Z-axis with finger. When the finger

is released, it returns to the original position.

Check that no heaviness, unsteady movement,

or abnormal sound compared to other spline

shaft is found.

NOTE

Do not touch the shaft as the surface may get rusted if

lacking grease.

CAUTION

Fatal error may occur if operating a machine with

unsteady movement of spline shaft. Stop the machine in

this case and contact your distributor.

Step 2 Checking Z-axis operation

this case and contact your distributor.

Step 2 Checking Z-axis operation

Path Image Checking Z-axis operation : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/ThreeMonth_Maintenance/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_3_3.2_3.2.1_Checking_Zaxis_op.png

3.2.2 Checking and Cleaning Around Spline Shaft

Check and clean the area around the spline shaft of the head.

Step 1 Move the head unit.

1. Press the emergency stop button and

detach the feeder exchange carriage.

2. Open the machine safety cover and move

the head unit forward.

Step 2 Visually check around the spline shaft.

Check around the spline shaft that no dust or

dirt is found on the spline shaft.

Step 3 Clean the spline shaft.

Clean the spline shaft when dust or dirt is

found, by wiping with a lint-free cloth or cotton

swab.

CAUTION

Do not completely wipe off grease on the spline shaft

surface as the surface may get rusted due to the lack of

grease. However, apply grease for anti-rust with the

procedure on next page if the grease is wiped off due to

cleaning.

Step 3 Cleaning spline shaft

Path Image Cleaning spline shaft : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/ThreeMonth_Maintenance/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_3_3.2_3.2.2_Cleaning_spline_shaft.png

3.2.3 Applying Grease to Spline Shaft

Perform this procedure as necessary.

Basically, it is not necessary to apply grease to spline shaft (Z-axis) of HM head unit. However, if touching the shaft surface or solvent sprayed on it, the grease is removed and rust may appear. Slightly apply specified grease (NSL) for anti-rust as needed.

Step 1 Move the head unit.

1. Press the emergency stop button and

detach the feeder exchange carriage.

2. Open the machine safety cover and move

the head unit to convenient position to

work.

Step 2 Clean the spline shaft.

Wipe the spline shaft using a lint-free cloth or

cotton swab.

Step 3 Apply grease to the spline shaft.

Put a small amount of the specified grease

(NSL) onto a finger wearing protective glove,

and spread it uniformly and thinly over the

surface of the spline shaft.

Step 3 Applying grease to spline shaft

surface of the spline shaft.

Step 3 Applying grease to spline shaft

Path Image Applying grease to spline shaft : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/ThreeMonth_Maintenance/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_3_3.2_3.2.3_Applying_grease.png

Step 4 Wipe off the excess grease.

1. Move up/down the spline shaft several

times by hand.

2. Wipe off excess grease on top and bottom

of the spline shaft with lint-free cloth or

cotton swab.

CAUTION

Make sure not to wipe off grease on spline shaft surface completely.

3.3 RM Head Unit

3.3.1 Inspecting and Cleaning Nozzle Shaft Tip

The dirt on the nozzle tip may cause shaft operation error or nozzle change error.

Therefore, perform visual inspection and cleaning of the shaft tip once every three months

.

Step 1 Prepare for work.

1. Remove all items sensitive to magnetic fields such as wristwatches and magnetic ID cards.

2. If the machine is equipped with nozzle station, store all nozzles to the nozzle station.

3. Press the emergency stop button, detach the feeder exchange carriage, then open the machine safety cover.

4. Move the head unit to convenient position to work and place a square cloth under the head unit.

NOTE

For a machine equipped with a nozzle station, when detaching the nozzles, make sure to detach them automatically by

pressing the [nozzle Change] button on the [unit] > [head] tab screen.

TIP

See “1.4.1 How to Lower RM head nozzle Shafts” in this chapter for details of the lowering the RM head nozzle shaft.

Step 2 Inspect the nozzle shaft tip.

Step 2 Inspect the nozzle shaft tip.

1. Turn the rotary so that the relevant nozzle

shaft locates under the Z-axis.

2. Push the Z-axis down with finger to lower

the nozzle shaft.

3. When the nozzle station is not equipped,

detach the nozzle manually.

4. Check that no dirt is found on the position

shown at right.

5. Check that the O-ring shown in the right has

not fallen off or been damaged. In such

cases, replace the O-ring with a new one.

TIP

For details on how to replace the O-ring, see “2.3 RM

head: Replacing O-Ring of nozzle Shaft Tip” in Chapter 5.

NOTE

Check the inside of shaft with a hand mirror or the similar.

Step 2 Inspecting nozzle shaft tip

Path Image Inspecting nozzle shaft tip : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/ThreeMonth_Maintenance/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_3_3.3_3.3.1_Inspecting_nozzle_shaft.png

Step 3 Clean the nozzle shaft tip.

1. Lower the nozzle shaft with the same

procedure as Step 2.

Step 3 Clean the nozzle shaft tip.

1. Lower the nozzle shaft with the same

procedure as Step 2.

2. Wipe off dirt on the nozzle shaft tip with

cotton swab.

If it is very dirty, wipe it off with a lint-free

cloth.

CAUTION

after inspecting and cleaning the nozzle shaft, make

sure all nozzle shafts are in their original top positions.

Step 3 Cleaning nozzle shaft tip

Path Image Cleaning nozzle shaft tip : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/ThreeMonth_Maintenance/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_3_3.3_3.3.1_Cleaning_nozzle_shaft_tip.png

Step 4 Inspect and clean rest of nozzle tips.

1. Inspect and clean rest of nozzle tips with

the same procedures as Steps 2 to 3.

2. Remove the square cloth after working.

CAUTION

Make sure that all nozzle shafts are completely raised

up after they returned.

Step 5 Return the nozzles to their original positions.

On a machine not equipped with a nozzle

station, when the nozzles have been detached

On a machine not equipped with a nozzle

station, when the nozzles have been detached

by hand from the head, return each nozzle to

the head from which it was detached.

3.4 FM Head Unit

3.4.1 Cleaning and Lubricating Around Z-Axis Ball Screw

Basically, the FM head unit requires cleaning and lubrication of the ball screw, spline shaft, and guide once every three months. Follow the procedures below.

Step 1 Move the head unit.

1. Remove all items sensitive to magnetic

fields such as wristwatches and magnetic

ID cards.

e 2. Press the emergency stop button, detach

the feeder exchange carriage, then open the

machine safety cover.

3. Move the head unit to convenient position

to work.

4. Place a square cloth under the head unit.

Step 2 Detach the air hoses and cover.

1. Remove the four fixing bolts on the front

cover using a hex wrench (3 mm), while

holding the cover to prevent from falling.

2. Detach air hose from upper/lower joint.

NOTE

Detach air hoses while they are attached to cover.

Step 2 Detaching front cover

Path Image Detaching front cover : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/ThreeMonth_Maintenance/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_3_3.4_3.4.1_Detaching_front.png

metadata.sub_sub_section: 3.4.1|Cleaning and Lubricating Around Z-Axis Ball Screw

content:
Step 3 Clean the ball screw.

Wipe off the ball screw using a lint-free cloth.

1. Lower the head and clean its upper area.

2. Raise the head and clean its lower area.

NOTE

When cleaning the ball screw, carefully clean its grooves

as well. after cleaning, make sure that no dust, lint, or

debris remains on the ball screw.

Step 3 Cleaning ball screw

	Path Image Cleaning ball screw : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/ThreeMonth_Maintenance/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_3_3.4_3.4.1_Cleaning_ball_screw_FM.png

Step 4 Clean the spline shaft and guide.

Wipe the spline shaft and guide off using a

lint-free cloth while raising/lowering them as

same as the ball screw.

Step 4 Cleaning spline shaft and guide

Path Image  Cleaning spline shaft and guide : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/ThreeMonth_Maintenance/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_3_3.4_3.4.1_Cleaning_spline_shaft_guide.png

Step 5 Apply grease to the guide.

metadata.sub_sub_section: 3.4.1|Cleaning and Lubricating Around Z-Axis Ball Screw

content:
Step 5 Apply grease to the guide.

Apply specified grease (AFF) to the guide

uniformly by hand wearing protective gloves.

Use such as cotton swab for the area, like the

head at the center section or so, where

prevents your hand.

Step 6 Apply grease to the ball screw.

Apply specified grease (NSL) to the ball screw

uniformly by hand wearing protective gloves.

Use such as cotton swab for the area, like the

head at the center section or so, where

prevents your hand.

Step 7 Apply grease to the spline shaft.

Apply specified grease (LRL) to the spline

shaft uniformly by hand wearing protective

gloves.

NOTE

The three kinds of grease are used for this procedure. Be

careful not to apply inappropriate grease.

Step 8 Wipe off the excessive grease.

Raise and lower the head several times, and

then wipe off the excessive grease.

Step 8 Wiping off excessive grease

content:
then wipe off the excessive grease.

Step 9 Return the head to its original position.

1. Attach the air hose.

2. Attach the front cover.

3. Remove the square cloth.

3.5.2 Checking and Cleaning Metal Filter (Nozzle Arm Assembly)

The nozzle arm assembly for LM heads has metal filters built into the air path.

Basically, the metal filter requires checking for dirt and cleaning once every three months.

Follow the procedures below.

Step 1 Move the head unit.

1. Remove all items sensitive to magnetic

fields such as wristwatches and magnetic

ID cards.

2. Press the emergency stop button, detach

the feeder exchange carriage, then open the

machine safety cover.

3. Move the head unit to convenient position

If using a bit with the wrong size, the bit slot of the

metal filter may become damaged, and the metal filter

may become impossible to remove.

3.6 PU-Axis

The PU-axis (push-up axis) takes an essential role which prevents board warpage when clamping a board and board sinking when transferring. Moreover, the PU-axis functions as preventing mounting accuracy offset caused by the board sinking when transferring. Therefore, the periodical inspecting/cleaning should be performed to maintain its function.

CAUTION

When the PU-axis related trouble occurs, then contact your distributor.

Disassembly and cleaning of the PU-axis by the user will void the warranty.

3.6.1 Cleaning and Lubricating PU-Axis Ball Screw

For Dual-stage and Single-lane type

Step 1 Prepare for work.

1. Remove all items sensitive to magnetic

fields such as wristwatches and magnetic

ID cards.

2. For Dual-stage type: Read any board data.

NOTE

For Dual-stage type, moving the push-up unit of both

Stage 1 and 2 are available by reading board data.

Step 2 Maximize the conveyor width.

1. Press the [Width] button on the [unit] >

[conveyor] tab screen to display the

“conveyor Width” screen.

2. For both Dual-stage type and Single-lane

type, input the maximum conveyor width,

510 mm, in the “Target Width” field and

press the [OK] button.

Then, the conveyor width will be changed to

the specified width.

Step 3 Raise the push-up unit.

1. Press the [Push Up] button of the target

stage to display the “conveyor Pushup”

screen.

2. Input “0.1 mm” in the “board thickness”

field and press the [OK] button. Then the

push-up unit will raise.

NOTE

When the board size X of the board data selected at Step

push-up unit will raise.

NOTE

When the board size X of the board data selected at Step

1 excesses 380 mm, the [Push Up] button of upstream

side is grayed-out. The upstream push-up unit raises

engaging with the raise of downstream push-up unit.

Step 2,3 Changing the conveyor width

Path Image Changing the conveyor width  : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/ThreeMonth_Maintenance/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_3_3.6_3.6.1_Changing_conveyor_width_PU.png

Step 4 Remove old grease.

1. Press the emergency stop button and

detach the feeder exchange carriage, then

open the machine safety cover.

2. Wipe away old grease completely from two

ball screws using a lint-free cloth.

n NOTE

The number of the PU-axis ball screws differs depending

on the machine specifications as follows:

• Dual-stage type: 2

• Single-lane type: 1

NOTE

Carefully wipe the grooves of the ball screw during

cleaning. Also, make sure that no dust, lint, and debris

cleaning. Also, make sure that no dust, lint, and debris

remain on the ball screw.

Step 4 Cleaning the ball screw

Path Image Cleaning the ball screw : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/ThreeMonth_Maintenance/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_3_3.6_3.6.1_Cleaning_ball_screw_PU.png

Step 5 Apply new grease.

Put about 2 cm of new grease on a finger

wearing protective glove and spread it

uniformly over the lead of the ball screw.

Step 5 Applying grease

Path Image Applying grease : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/ThreeMonth_Maintenance/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_3_3.6_3.6.1_Applying_grease_PU.png

Step 6 Spread grease.

1. Close the machine safety cover, attach the

feeder exchange carriage and release the

emergency stop.

2. Press the [Push Up] button to lower the

push-up unit.

3. Raise the push-up unit as the same

procedure of Step 3.

4. Repeat up/down for some times to spread

procedure of Step 3.

4. Repeat up/down for some times to spread

grease. The push-up unit should stay its upmost position after lubrication.

Step 7 Remove excess grease by hand.

1. Press the emergency stop button and

detach the feeder exchange carriage.

Then open the machine safety cover.

2. Remove excess grease by hand wearing

protective gloves.

For Dual-lane type

Step 1 Prepare for work.

Remove all items sensitive to magnetic fields

such as wristwatches and magnetic ID cards.

Step 2 Change the conveyor width of Lane 1.

1. Press the [Width] button on the [unit] >

[conveyor] tab screen to display the

“conveyor Width” screen.

2. Mark the “Lane 1” checkbox and input the

conveyor width of about “500” in the “Target

Width” field. Then press the [OK] button.

The conveyor width will be changed to the

specified width.

NOTE

Change the conveyor width so that the PU plate can be

detached easily.

detached easily.

Step 3 Remove the PU plate.

1. Press the emergency stop button and

2. Using a T-type or hex wrench (4 mm),

As there are two stages per lane, there are

eight bolts in total.

NOTE

The bolts of the PU plate are tightened firmly with a

tightening torque of 7.5 N·m. They can be removed with a

hex wrench, but the use of a T-type wrench is

• Tightening torque: 7.5 N·m

3.7 Base Unit

The YRM20/YRM20DL is equipped with the four upper fan filter (exhaust) on the upper surface of the

machine cover, four air intake filter, each two for the front and rear side of the machine, to cool down the

axes, and one air intake filter on the machine rear side to protect the control unit. Neglecting to clean the filters could cause filter clogging and a temperature rise in the machine. Clean each filter to maintain machine performance and ensure a long service life.

NOTE

Power off the machine to perform these cleaning as the dust gathered by filter may get into the machine.

3.7.1 Cleaning Upper Fan Filters

Step 1 Power off the machine.

Exit the software and power off the machine.

Step 2 Detach the filter cover with fan filter.

1. Loosen the fixing bolt of filter cover using a

hex wrench (3 mm).

2. Pull out the filter cover upward.

Step 2 Detaching filter cover

Path Image Detaching filter cover : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/ThreeMonth_Maintenance/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_3_3.7_3.7.1_Detaching_filter.png

Step 3 Clean the fan filter.

Clean both side of the detached filter cover

using a vacuum cleaner or a vacuum assembly

to remove the dust of the filter.

CAUTION

The filters can be enough cleaned with vacuum cleaner.

The wet filters may lead clogging because the

moisturized dust make mass. Do not use water for

cleaning.

NOTE

If the dust cannot be removed or the fan filter has worn

out, replace the filter with a new one. It is recommended

to replace the filter once every three years.

Replacing upper fan filter

to replace the filter once every three years.

Replacing upper fan filter

Step 4 Replace the fan filter.

1. Reverse the filter cover and remove the four

fixing nuts using a spanner (7 mm), shown

in the figure right.

2. Replace the filter with a new one.

3. Fit the filter covers and tighten the four

fixing nuts, referring to the figure on the

right. At this time, the low frame folded part

should be aligned with the U-shaped groove

side of the other filter cover.

Step 4 Replacing fan filter

Path Image Replacing fan filter : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/ThreeMonth_Maintenance/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_3_3.7_3.7.1_Replacing_fan_filter.png

Step 5 Return the filter cover with fan filter.

1. Push in the filter cover to its mounting

position, shown in the figure right.

2. Tighten the fixing bolt of the filter cover

using a hex wrench (3 mm).

Step 5 Attaching new filter

using a hex wrench (3 mm).

Step 5 Attaching new filter

Path Image Attaching new filter : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/ThreeMonth_Maintenance/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_3_3.7_3.7.1_Attaching_new_filter.png

3.7.2 Cleaning Air Intake Filter

Usually, the air intake filters at the front and rear

side of machine can be cleaned by sucking dust

and dirt through the filter cover using a vacuum

assembly or a vacuum cleaner, shown in the figure

right.

If the dust cannot be removed completely, replace

the filter with a new one. It is recommended to

replace the filter once every three years.

CAUTION

Do not clean the filter during automatic operation.

NOTE

When the filter is cleaned by vacuum assembly, the feeder

exchange carriage is required to set to machine, as the air

joint of feeder exchange carriage is used for cleaning.

Cleaning air intake filter

Path Image Cleaning air intake filter : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/ThreeMonth_Maintenance/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_3_3.7_3.7.2_Cleaning_air_intake_filter.png

Replacement of air intake filter

The air intake filter can be replaced without tools.

Step 1 Open the machine safety cover.

Step 2 Remove the air intake filter.

Step 1 Open the machine safety cover.

Step 2 Remove the air intake filter.

The air intake filter is located in the gap

between the frame and cover. Pull out the air

intake filter to the arrow direction by grabbing

the handle of the filter.

Step 2 Removing air intake filter

Path Image Removing air intake filter : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/ThreeMonth_Maintenance/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_3_3.7_3.7.2_Removing_air_intake_filter.png

Step 3 Attach a new air intake filter.

Insert a new filter passing along the beneath

of guide, be aware the direction of it.

Step 3 Attaching air intake filter

Path Image  Attaching air intake filter : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/ThreeMonth_Maintenance/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_3_3.7_3.7.2_Attachingair_intake_filter.png

3.7.3 Cleaning Air Intake Filter at machine Rear Side

The air intake filter is located at the right side of machine rear, protecting the control section.

This filter should be cleaned every three months, though it depends on the machine operating condition.

It is also recommended to replace the filter once every three years.

Step 1 Turn OFF the machine power.

Exit the software and turn OFF the machine power.

CAUTION

Be sure to turn off the power for this work. DO NOT clean during the automatic operation.

NOTE

When the vacuum assembly is used for cleaning, the feeder exchange carriage is required to be attached as the air source.

Step 2 Clean the filter.

Using a household vacuum cleaner or a vacuum assembly (option), remove the dust on the filter

from outside of the cover.

NOTE

When the dust or dirt cannot be removed from outside of the cover, or the filter itself is deteriorated, it requires the filter

replacement detaching the cover.

Cleaning air intake filter

Lower right on rear of machine

4. Six-Month Maintenance This section describes six-month maintenance items.

4.1 Cleaning of Camera Lighting Unit

The camera lighting unit requires to be cleaned periodically, as it may be soiled by dust or dirt.

CAUTION

Do not apply strong force or shock to the camera unit and lighting unit during cleaning.

Optical axis adjustment might become unreliable.

CAUTION

When the trouble occurs with the lighting unit, contact your distributor.

Disassembly and cleaning of the lighting unit by the user will void the warranty.

4.1.1 Fiducial Camera

The fiducial camera is installed near the head. The cleaning procedure for the camera's lighting unit is

described below.

Step 1 Move the head unit.

1. Remove all items sensitive to magnetic

fields such as wristwatches and magnetic

ID cards.

2. Press the emergency stop button and

detach the feeder exchange carriage.

3. Open the machine safety cover and move

the head unit to a convenient position for

maintenance work.

Step 2 Clean the lighting unit.

Remove the dust from the lighting unit using a

blower brush.

Step 2 Using the blower brush to remove dust

Path Image Using the blower brush to remove dust : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/SixMonth_Maintenance/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_4_4.1_4.1.1_remove_dust_blower.png

Step 3 Clean the reflector plate.

Using a cotton swab applied with a small

amount of lens cleaner, clean the reflector

plate as shown in the figure right.

NOTE

The blower brush and lens cleaner are optional purchase

items.

NOTE

The blower brush and lens cleaner are optional purchase

items.

CAUTION

Do not apply strong force or shock to each section of

the camera unit during cleaning. The precision parts

installed inside the camera may be damaged.

Step 3 Cleaning reflector plate

Path Image Cleaning reflector plate : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/SixMonth_Maintenance/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_4_4.1_4.1.1_Cleaning_reflector_plate.png

4.1.2 Multi-Vision Camera

This section describes the cleaning procedure for the multi-vision camera lighting unit.

Step 1 Detach the camera cover.

1. Press the emergency stop button and

detach the feeder exchange carriage. Then

open the machine safety cover.

2. Loosen the four fixing bolts using a hex

wrench (2.5 mm) and pull out the lighting

cover (including protective glass) upward.

Step 1 Detaching camera cover (including protective glass)

Path Image Detaching camera cover (including protective glass) : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/SixMonth_Maintenance/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_4_4.1_4.1.2_Detaching_camera_cover.png

Step 2 Wipe the protective glass with a lintfree cloth.

Wipe the front and back sides of the protective

glass with a lint-free cloth applied with a few

drops of lens cleaner.

Step 3 Clean the lighting.

Clean the lighting using a blower brush to

remove the dust.

Step 3 Cleaning lighting

Clean the lighting using a blower brush to

remove the dust.

Step 3 Cleaning lighting

Path Image Cleaning lighting : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/SixMonth_Maintenance/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_4_4.1_4.1.2_Cleaning_lighting_MultiVision.png

Step 4 Clean the lens unit.

Clean the lens unit using a cotton swab

applied with a small amount of lens cleaner.

Step 4 Cleaning lens

Path Image Cleaning lens : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/SixMonth_Maintenance/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_4_4.1_4.1.2_Cleaning_lens.png

Step 5 Return the camera cover to its original place.

Return the camera cover to its original place

and tighten four fixing bolts.

NOTE

The blower brush and lens cleaner are optional purchase

items.

1. Apply a few drops of lens cleaner to a

4.1.3 Scan Camera for HM Head Unit

The lighting diffuser plate of scan camera and prism are mounted at the aperture located at left end of

camera. The diffuser plate and prism may be soiled with dust and dirt during long term using.

The periodical cleaning is recommended.

CAUTION

Do not apply strong force or shock to the camera unit during cleaning.

The glass parts installed inside of camera may be damaged.

Step 1 Store all the nozzles.

1. Open the [unit] > [head] tab screen.

2. Select any head unit from “Table Select”.

3. Press the [nozzle Change] button.

4. Select “ALL” for “head Number” and select

“Store nozzle” for “nozzle Type” on the

5. Press the [OK] button to return all nozzles

to the nozzle station.

NOTE

For a machine equipped with a nozzle station, when

detaching the nozzles, make sure to detach them

automatically by pressing the [nozzle Change] button on

the [unit] > [head] tab screen.

NOTE

For a machine not equipped with a nozzle station, press

the [unit] > [head] tab screen.

NOTE

For a machine not equipped with a nozzle station, press

the emergency stop button and remove nozzles by hand.

Step 1 Storing nozzle (for machine with nozzle station)

detach the feeder exchange carriage.

2. Open the machine safety cover and move

the head unit by hand to the convenient

position to work.

1. Confirm that all the heads stay at their

topmost position. When they interfere the

topmost position.

2. Move the scan camera to leftmost (head

No. 10 side) viewed from the front of head

unit. Avoid to apply excessive force.

Step 4 Clean the diffuser plate and prism.

unit. Avoid to apply excessive force.

1. Wipe away the soil on the upper surface of

the diffuser plate and prism for the main

lighting using a cotton swab. The prism

face is small, so that make the swab tip

thinner by twisting with your fingers and

wipe lightly with it.

2. Wipe the diffuser plate and prism for the

To see the prism surface from its front side,

use a hand mirror or similar tool.

CAUTION

Do not use a solvent (including lens cleaner). Using a

solvent may cause the surface coat of prism to damage,

or the diffuser plate surface to discolor.

Step 5 Return the nozzles to their original positions.

Return the nozzles to their original positions on the head. If the nozzles have been detached from the nozzle station, return them to the original storage positions of the nozzle station.

As the glass parts are equipped inside of camera, they may be damaged.

4.2 Base Unit

4.2.1 Cleaning Fan Filter of Control Box

The control box section, which controls the machine, is equipped the air intake fan and filter. These should be cleaned once six-month, though it depends on the machine operating condition. It is also recommended to replace the filter with a new one every three years.

NOTE

In the text, “DS” means Dual-stage, “SL” means Single-lane,

and “DL” means Dual-lane.

NOTE

The cleaning method for the fan filter of the control box

differs depending on whether the machine's serial number

is Y70968 or earlier or Y70969 or later. Therefore, check

the machine's serial number before cleaning it.

5 One-Year Maintenance

This section describes one-year maintenance items.

5.1 HM Head Unit

5.1.1 Cleaning Spline Shaft Interior

Generally, the spline shaft interior should be cleaned once a year. Follow the procedures below.

Step 1 Store all the nozzles to the nozzle station.

1. Open the [unit] > [head] tab screen.

2. Select any head unit from “Table Select”.

3. Press the [nozzle Change] button.

4. Select “ALL” for “head Number” and select

“Store nozzle” for “nozzle Type” on the

“nozzle Change” screen.

5. Press the [OK] button to return all nozzles

to the nozzle station.

NOTE

For a machine equipped with a nozzle station, when

detaching the nozzles, make sure to detach them

automatically by pressing the [nozzle Change] button on

the [unit] > [head] tab screen.

NOTE

When the nozzle station is not equipped, press the

emergency stop button and detach the nozzles by hand.

Step 2 Move the head unit.

1. Press the emergency stop button and

detach the feeder exchange carriage.

2. Open the machine safety cover and move

the head unit to convenient position to

work.

Step 3 Remove the air hose.

the head unit to convenient position to

work.

Step 3 Remove the air hose.

Pull out the lower end of air hose.

Step 3 Removing the air hose

Path Image Removing the air hose : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/OneYear_Maintenance/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_5_5.1_5.1.1_Removing_air_hose.png

Step 4 Fix the Z-axis at the working position.

Fix the Z-axis as shown in the figure right, by

placing the Z-axis linear scale hidden by shaft,

and by inserting a hex wrench into the Z-axis

fixing hole.

NOTE

As there are cables around the head and they may prevent

a hex wrench to insert into the hole. In such case, use a

wire (less than ø 2.5 mm) or similar instead to mount the

Z-axis.

NOTE

The common type hex wrench can fix approximately five

heads at once. HM head unit has ten heads, so cleaning

them in two part is recommended.

Step 4 Fixing the Z-axis

them in two part is recommended.

Step 4 Fixing the Z-axis

Path Image Fixing the Z-axis : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/OneYear_Maintenance/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_5_5.1_5.1.1_Fixing_Zaxis.png

Step 5 Detach the maintenance bolt.

Detach the maintenance bolt using a flat-head

screwdriver or a precision spanner.

Step 5 Detaching the maintenance bolt

Path Image Detaching the maintenance bolt : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/OneYear_Maintenance/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_5_5.1_5.1.1_Detaching_maintenance_bolt.png

Step 6 Prepare for cleaning.

1. Place a paper cup or a lint-free cloth

beneath the target head.

2. Refill the ethanol into cleaning kit.

Step 7 Clean the spline shaft interior.

1. Insert the nozzle of the cleaning kit into the

cleaning hole of the spline shaft.

2. Pour ethanol into the spline shaft air path

to clean away dust and grime.

CAUTION

2. Pour ethanol into the spline shaft air path

to clean away dust and grime.

CAUTION

Be sure to insert the cleaning kit tip at least 25 mm into

the spline shaft. If not inserted enough, absolute

ethanol might flow out on the packing.

Step 7 Cleaning the spline shaft interior 

	Path Image Cleaning the spline shaft interior : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/OneYear_Maintenance/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_5_5.1_5.1.1_Cleaning_spline_shaft_interior.png

Step 8 Blow air into the spline air path.

1. Prepare an air blow tool (option) and

connect it to the air connector located at

the center of the feeder exchange carriage.

2. Close the hole pulled out the air hose to

prevent the air leakage, then air-blow the

spline shaft interior.

3. Check that the soiled ethanol has not been

exhausted from the tip of spline shaft.

NOTE

Repeat Steps 6 and 7 until the absolute ethanol flown out

from spline shaft becomes clear.

Step 8 Blowing the air path

from spline shaft becomes clear.

Step 8 Blowing the air path

Path Image Blowing the air path : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/OneYear_Maintenance/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_5_5.1_5.1.1_Blowing_air_path.png

Step 9 Return the head to its original position.

1. Mount the maintenance bolt, insert the air

hose and attach the nozzle.

2. Pull out the hex wrench (or the wire) fixing

the Z-axis.

NOTE

On a machine not equipped with a nozzle station, when

the nozzles have been detached by hand from the head,

return each nozzle to the head from which it was

detached.

5.4 Inspecting Conveyor Belt and Cleaning Guide

Inspect the worn status of conveyor belt. As the worn of belt transferring surface proceeds, a stable board transfer is disturbed by slip. The periodical inspection of the worn status is required.

Moreover, small particles of worn parts piled on the light-receiving surface of conveyor sensor may lead a

mis-detection of board or so. And small particles of worn parts which piled up around the belt guide or the outer periphery of pulley may make the belt stuck.

button. Then the conveyor width will be

changed to the specified width.

5.5 Cleaning and Greasing W-Axis

The cleaning and lubricating of the ball screw, guide, and hexagon spline of W-axis and U-axis (for Dualstage type) is required once a year. See also “Chapter 4 Lubrication Points List” for lubricating points. Note that cleaning and lubricating procedures differ between Dual-stage type and Single-lane type. Each procedure is described below.

5.5.1 Dual-Stage: Cleaning and Greasing W-Axis and U-Axis

Step 1 Read any board data.

NOTE

after reading the board data, the push-up unit of both

Stages 1 and 2 can be moved.

Step 2 Minimize the conveyor width.

1. Press the [Width] button on the [unit] >

[conveyor] tab screen to display the

“conveyor Width” screen.

2. Input the minimum conveyor width of “50

mm” in the “Target Width” field and press

the [OK] button.

Then the conveyor width will be changed to

the specified width.

Step 2 Minimizing the conveyor width

Path Image Minimizing the conveyor width : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/OneYear_Maintenance/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_5_5.5_5.5.1_Minimizing_conveyor_width.png

Step 3 Raise the push-up unit.

1. Press the [Push Up] button to display the

“conveyor Push Up” screen.

2. Input “0.1 mm” in the “Thickness” field and

press the [OK] button. Then the push-up

unit will raise.

3. Raise the push-up units of both Stages 1

and 2 by the procedure above.

NOTE

ID cards.

3. Wipe away old grease or dirt from all over

hexagon spline of W-axis and U-axis, using

NOTE

Carefully wipe the lead grooves of ball screw and the

grooves of guide rail during cleaning. Also, make sure that

no dust, lint and debris remain on the ball screw and

guide.

TIP

See also “Chapter 4 Lubrication Points List” for the

location and number of the ball screw, guide, and hexagon spline.

5.6 Base Unit

5.6.1 Replacing Air and Mist Filter Elements and Cleaning Cups

An air filter and an oil mist filter are installed in the YRM20/YRM20DL to prevent oil, water, and impurities in the air compressor from entering the machine.

These filters usually require inspecting and cleaning once a year. If the filter element inside the filter is

dirty, replace it with a new one. It is also recommended to replace the filter elements with new ones every three years.

Detach the air coupler from the air supply fitting to ensure worker safety.

Step 1 Detach the air coupler of air supply.

1. Rotate the “air supply/exhaust” switch to

left (EXH) to shut down the air supply.

2. Detach the air coupler from the air supply

fitting.

CAUTION

When disconnecting the air coupler from the air supply

fitting, be aware that a loud air exhaust sound occurs.

Also be aware of oil, water, and impurities that may

spray out.

Step 2 Check the inside of the filer cup.

Check if there is oil or water in the filter cup.

If the filter cup is dirty, follow the procedure of

metadata.sub_sub_section: 5.6.1|Replacing Air and Mist Filter Elements and Cleaning Cups

content:
If the filter cup is dirty, follow the procedure of

Steps 3 to 6 to clean the filter cup.

NOTE

The drain cock at the bottom of the filter cup is an

auto-drain type. When oil or water pools in the cup, it

automatically drains. For this reason, it is recommend to

connect a hose to this drain cock.

Step 3 Detach the filter cup.

Oil mist filter:

While pushing down the cup's button, turn the

cup 45-degree to the left. Then pull the cup

downward to detach it.

air filter:

1. While pushing down the cup's button, turn

the cup 45-degree to the left. Then pull the

cup downward to detach it.

2. Pull out the internal filter upward from

inside the air filter.

Step 3 Detaching the filter cup

Oil mist filter element:

The mist filter element is attached to the

The mist filter element is attached to the

screw protruded from the filter housing.

Detach the mist filter element by rotating.

air filter element:

The filter element is set in the cup between

the upper and lower adapters. Pull out upward

with adapters and detach the filter element by

rotating the adapters.

If soiled, replace it with a new one.

the filter cup and clean the inside while

shaking it.

3. air blow the filter cup and wipe away any

5.7 Feeder Exchange Carriage

5.7.1 Cleaning and Greasing Carriage Lift Shaft

Clean and lubricate the lift shaft of the feeder exchange carriage once a year.

Step 1 Detach the feeder exchange carriage.

Press the emergency stop button and detach the feeder exchange carriage.

Step 2 Clean the carriage lift shaft.

Wipe away the old grease or dirt on the two carriage lift shafts using a lint-free cloth or the similar.

Step 3 Grease the carriage lift shaft.

Apply the specified grease (NSL) uniformly to the carriage lift shafts by hand wearing protective

gloves.

6 Two-Year Maintenance

This section describes Two-year maintenance items.

6.1 HM, FM, and LM Head Units

6.1.1 Replacing Ejector Bit

The ejector bit deteriorates its function during a long time usage. Its replacement to the new ejector bit is recommended in every two years to keep the machine performance, even it depends the operating

condition. Here describes the replacement method.

CAUTION

A bit is non-reusable. The new one should be prepared for replacement.

Step 1 Prepare for work.

1. Remove all items sensitive to magnetic

fields such as wristwatches and magnetic

ID card.

2. Press the emergency stop button and

detach the feeder exchange carriage.

3. Open the machine safety cover and place a

square cloth just below the target head unit.

Step 2 (For FM head unit) Remove the head cover.

Remove four fixing bolt of the head cover using

a hex wrench (2.5 mm), then detach it.

Step 2 Detaching the head cover

6.2 RM Head Unit

6.2.1 Cleaning and Lubricating Scissors Gears

This section describes cleaning and lubricating the rotating axis (N-axis) in the rotary unit and the gears in the rotating axis (R-axis) of each head all housed in the RM head.

Step 1 Prepare for work.

1. Remove all items sensitive to magnetic

fields such as wristwatches and magnetic

ID cards.

2. Press the emergency stop button and then

detach the feeder exchange carriage.

3. Open the machine safety cover and move

the head unit to a convenient position for

maintenance work.

Step 2 Clean the scissors gear.

While rotating the scissors gears R-axis and

N-axis by hand, wipe off any dirt from the gear

section, which is the two scissors gears and

the engaging gear, using a lint-free cloth or the

similar.

Step 2 Cleaning the scissors gears 

Path Image Cleaning the scissors gears : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/OneYear_Maintenance/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_6_6.2_6.2.1_Cleaning_scissors_gears.png

Step 3 Apply grease.

Step 3 Apply grease.

1. Apply the specified grease (LG2) to the

scissors gears of R-axis and N-axis, using

your finger or a lint-free cloth.

2. Rotate the R-axis gear by hand to spread

grease to the whole gear.

Step 4 Wipe off excess grease.

Wipe off excess grease that overflowed from

the gears using a lint-free cloth.

6.2.2 Cleaning and Lubricating Upper Part of Nozzle Shaft

Clean and lubricate the upper part of the RM head nozzle shafts.

The dedicated oil (KMB-M3855-00) is required to lubricate the upper part of nozzle shafts.

Step 1 Prepare for work.

1. Remove all items sensitive to magnetic

fields such as wristwatches and magnetic

ID cards.

2. Press the emergency stop button and

detach the feeder exchange carriage.

3. Open the machine safety cover and move

the head unit to a convenient position for

maintenance work.

Step 2 Cleaning the upper part of the shaft.

1. Use your finger to press down the nozzle

shaft spring of the head to be cleaned.

2. Wipe away dust or dirt from the upper part

of the nozzle shaft using a cotton swab.

Step 3 Apply the specified oil.

Using a cotton swab dampened with the

specified oil (dedicated to the upper part of

the shaft), apply the oil thinly and uniformly

over the upper 10 mm of the shaft.

TIP

If the target head spring locates where being difficult to

metadata.sub_sub_section: 6.2.2|Cleaning and Lubricating Upper Part of Nozzle Shaft

content:
6.2.3 Cleaning and Lubricating Vacuum Selector (Spool)

The RM head switches between vacuum and blow by way of an up and down spool movement in each head. The spool should be cleaned and lubricated about every two years as a general guide.

Lubricating the spool requires the dedicated grease (Grease for spool: GREASE 30G KMB-M3854-00).

Step 1 Prepare for work.

1. Remove all items sensitive to magnetic

fields such as wristwatches and magnetic

ID cards.

2. Press the emergency stop button and

detach the feeder exchange carriage.

Then open the machine safety cover.

3. Move the head unit to a convenient position

for maintenance work and place a square

cloth beneath it.

Step 2 Pull out the spool.

The spool can be pull out by gripping its upper

side with fingers and pulling out upward.

If the spool is difficult to pinch with fingers,

use a long-nose pliers or the similar.

TIP

If the spool is in a position that is difficult to pull out, turn

the N-axis gear to rotate the rotary referring to “1.4.1 How

the N-axis gear to rotate the rotary referring to “1.4.1 How

to Lower RM head nozzle Shafts” in this chapter.

CAUTION

Remove the spool completely. Turning the rotary unit

while removing the spool may cause contact with the

V-axis (Valve axis / spool up-down axis).

Step 2 Pulling out the spool

Path Image Pulling out the spool : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/TwoYear_Maintenance/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_6_6.2_6.2.3_Pulling_spool.png

Step 3 Clean the spool.

Wipe off old grease and dirt on the spool using

a lint-free cloth.

Step 4 Grease the spool.

Apply the specified grease (dedicated grease

for spool) thinly and uniformly to the spool by

hand.

Step 4 Greasing the spool

Path Image Greasing the spool : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/TwoYear_Maintenance/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_6_6.2_6.2.3_Greasing_spool.png

Step 5 Return the spool to its original position.

Insert the spool firmly to its original position.

Insert the spool firmly to its original position.

CAUTION

Firmly insert the spool to its original position. Turning

the rotary unit while inserting the spool may cause

contact with the V-axis (Valve axis/spool up-down axis).

Step 6 Clean and lubricate the other spools.

1. Clean and lubricate rest of spools with the

same procedures as Steps 2 to 5.

2. Remove a square cloth after working.

Switching vacuum/blow with spool

The RM head switches vacuum/blow by moving the spool up and down with the up/down operation of

V-axis on both sides of the head unit.

• When the spool descends, air will be supplied to the nozzle shaft.

• When the spool ascends, the nozzle shaft will connect to the vacuum line.

Moving the spool up/down using the V-axis

Path Image Moving the spool up/down using the V-axis: Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/TwoYear_Maintenance/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_6_6.2_6.2.3_Moving_spool_updown_Vaxis.png

7 Three-Year Maintenance

This section describes Three-year maintenance items.

7.1 Vacuum Pump Unit

Precautions when handling vacuum pump

• The inside of the pump is hot shortly after operation. Wait about ten minutes after stopping operation and make sure the pump has cooled down before starting the replacement.

• Wear dust-proof mask and gloves when replacing the filter or vacuum pump. Otherwise you might inhale small particles of worn parts or the hand might be injured.

• The pump weighs approximately 10 kg. Be careful not to injure your feet by dropping it or hurt your back when handling it.

7.1.1 Replacing Filter for Vacuum Pump

One air filter is used per one vacuum pump installed in machine.

Inspect the filter at least once a year. The replacement of the filter is recommended once every three years to prevent the trouble caused by clogging.

Make sure to detach the air coupler from the air supply fitting to ensure worker safety.

NOTE

In the text, “DS” means Dual-stage, “SL” means Single-lane, and “DL” means Dual-lane.

Step 1 Prepare for work.

1. Press the emergency stop button and

detach the feeder exchange carriage on

machine rear side.

2. Exit applications and turn OFF the machine

power.

Step 2 Remove the fixing screws beneath the tape cutter safety cover.

DS, SL type

Using a Phillips screwdriver, remove the fixing

screws from the left-right joint part and the

machine body fixing part beneath the tape

cutter safety cover (hereinafter referred to as cutter cover)

DL type

The partition plate serves as a bracket for

attaching the safety cover and as a left-right

The partition plate serves as a bracket for

attaching the safety cover and as a left-right

joint part. Using a Phillips screwdriver, remove

the fixing screws from the partition plate and

machine body fixing part.

Though it may vary with the machine operating status, the vacuum pump should normally be replaced every three years. It cannot be overhauled, so use it as consumable item.

7.3 Replacing Conveyor Belt

In this chapter, “5.4 Inspecting conveyor belt and Cleaning Guide”, if there is excessive looseness, grime, or fraying of the conveyor belt, the conveyor belt should be replaced.

7.3.1 Dual-Stage

The following describes the procedure to replace the conveyor belt for the Dual-stage type.

The replacement procedure after Step 5 is different for CV1, CV2, and CV4 and for CV3. Therefore, each is described separately.

Step 1 Change the conveyor width to convenient for maintenance work.

1. Press the [Width] button on the [unit] >

[conveyor] tab screen and open the

conveyor width changing screen.

2. Input the value (approx. 200 mm) in the

“Target Width” for the width at which a hex

wrench can be inserted.

Press the [OK] button. Then the conveyor

width will be changed to the specified

width.

fields such as wristwatches and magnetic

ID cards.

on the bearing part of the pulley. Do not use solvent (IPA

For conveyor belt replacement of CV1, CV4, CV5, and CV8, see “Replacing CV1, CV4, CV5, CV8 conveyor belts” on page 3-132 of this chapter.

Step 5 Separate the coupling from the drive pulley.

1. Using a hex wrench (2.5 mm), remove the

two bolts on the coupling.

2. Slide the coupling in the arrow direction

from the drive pulley (hereinafter referred

to as pulley) to create a gap.

Step 5 Separating the coupling

to as pulley) to create a gap.

Step 5 Separating the coupling

Path Image Separating the coupling : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/ThreeYear_Maintenance/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_7_7.3_7.3.3_Separating_coupling_cv6.png

Step 6 Detach the conveyor belt from the conveyor.

Detach the conveyor belt through the created

gap between the coupling and pulley.

Also detach the conveyor belt on the movable

conveyor rail side through this gap.

Step 6 Detaching the conveyor belt

Example: Fixed conveyor rail side of CV6
Path Image Example: Fixed conveyor rail side of CV6 : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/ThreeYear_Maintenance/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_7_7.3_7.3.3_Fixed_conveyor_rail_side_CV6.png

Example: Movable conveyor rail side of CV6

Example: Movable conveyor rail side of CV6

Path Image Example: Movable conveyor rail side of CV6 : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/ThreeYear_Maintenance/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_7_7.3_7.3.3_Movable_conveyor_rail_side_CV6.png

Step 7 Clean the belt guide and pulleys.

1. Use a vacuum assembly (option) to suction

the belt wear debris on the belt guides and

sensors, etc.

2. Use a plastic spatula or similar tool to

remove the belt wear debris adhering to the

outer peripheral surface of the pulleys.

3. Use a brush or similar tool to remove the

belt wear debris caught in the belt guides.

CAUTION

Use a plastic spatula and brush to avoid scratching the

pulleys and guides.

CAUTION

If the pulley is still dirty, clean it with absolute ethanol.

At this time, be careful not to get the absolute ethanol

on the bearing part of the pulley. Do not use solvent

(IPA, etc.) unless the pulley is excessively dirty.

Step 7 Cleaning the belt guide and pulleys

(IPA, etc.) unless the pulley is excessively dirty.

Step 7 Cleaning the belt guide and pulleys 

	Path Image Cleaning the belt guide and pulleys : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/ThreeYear_Maintenance/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_7_7.3_7.3.3_Cleaning_belt_guide_and_pulleys_CV6.png

Step 8 Replace the conveyor belt.

1. Temporarily place the new conveyor belt on the pulley.

2. Move the bracket to the marked position in Step 4 and tighten the fixing bolt.

CAUTION

The followings is the tightening torques of the bracket fixing bolt. Do not tighten the bolt excessively.

• Bracket fixing bolt: 3.8 N·m

3. If the belt is loose, adjust the position of the bracket to apply proper tension.

The tension measuring positions and the tension standards of Dual-lane type are shown below.

Use a tension gauge to adjust the belt tension as needed.

Tension measuring position and specified tension value of conveyor belt

Dual-lane (CV2, CV3, CV6, CV7)

Dual-lane (CV2, CV3, CV6, CV7)

Path Image Tension measuring position and specified tension value of conveyor belt : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/ThreeYear_Maintenance/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_7_7.3_7.3.3_Tension_measuring_position_and_specified_tension_value_conveyor_belt_Duallane.png

Step 9 Return the coupling to its original position.

1. Slide the coupling to insert it to the pulley.

2. Using a hex wrench (2.5 mm), tighten the two bolts on the coupling.

Step 10 Attach the board clamp plate and check that the conveyor belt is attached correctly.

Referring to Steps 10 to 11 in “Replacing CV1, CV4, CV5, CV8 conveyor belts” on page 3-132 of this chapter, attach the board clamp plate and check the condition of the attached belt.

8 Others

8.1 Cleaning Inside of Nozzle Shaft on RM Head Unit

When the vacuum level does not go down to 140 or less while nozzle is detached from RM head unit,

replace with new filter as a general. If vacuum level does not go down to the standard value even after

replacing filter, The air path in spline shaft may be dirty.

In this case, it is required to clean the inside of nozzle shaft. Note that clean 18 shafts of all heads as a rule even the vacuum level of one head does not go down to the standard value as shaft inside of other heads may be dirty.

Step 1 Store all nozzles to the nozzle station.

1. Open the [unit] > [head] tab screen.

2. Select desired head unit from “Table

Select”.

3. Press the [nozzle Change] button.

4. Select “ALL” for “head Number” and select

“Store nozzle” for “nozzle Type” on the

“nozzle Change” screen.

5. Press the [OK] button to return all nozzles

to the nozzle station.

NOTE

For a machine equipped with a nozzle station, when

detaching the nozzles, make sure to follow the above

metadata.sub_section: 8.1|Cleaning Inside of Nozzle Shaft on RM Head Unit

content:
detaching the nozzles, make sure to follow the above

procedure to automatically detach them.

NOTE

If the machine is not equipped with a nozzle station, press

the emergency stop button and then detach the nozzles

manually.

Step 1 Storing nozzle (for machine with nozzle station)

	Path Image Storing nozzle (for machine with nozzle station) : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/Others/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_8_8.1_Storing_nozzle_DuallStage.png

Step 2 Prepare for work.

1. Remove all items sensitive to magnetic

fields such as wristwatches and magnetic

ID cards.

2. Press the emergency stop button and

detach the feeder exchange carriage. Then open the machine safety cover.

Step 3. Move the head unit to convenient position

to work and place a square cloth beneath

the head unit.

3 Detach all filters.

See Step 3 of “1.4.3 Replacing air Filters”

above in this chapter to detach filters for all

heads.

Step 4 Clean and lubricate all spools.

metadata.sub_section: 8.1|Cleaning Inside of Nozzle Shaft on RM Head Unit

content:
above in this chapter to detach filters for all

heads.

Step 4 Clean and lubricate all spools.

See “6.2.3 Cleaning and Lubricating Vacuum

Selector (Spool)” above in this chapter to clean

and lubricate all spools.

NOTE

Detached spools have no problem even if they are

returned in different positions.

Step 5 Preclean inside of the nozzle shaft.

Preclean the nozzle shaft so that dirt and

foreign objects in it can be easily removed.

1. Insert a pipe cleaning brush (KMB-M3858-00)

deeply into the nozzle shaft and rotate it

two or three times.

2. Clean the rest of the nozzle shaft insides

with the same procedures above.

NOTE

• Do not hold the edge of the pipe cleaning brush.

Doing so may bend the brush.

• Depending on how dirty the brush is, one brush can

clean one RM head unit, or 18 heads.

Step 5 Precleaning inside of the nozzle shaft

metadata.sub_section: 8.1|Cleaning Inside of Nozzle Shaft on RM Head Unit

content:
clean one RM head unit, or 18 heads.

Step 6 Set all spools to the “blow position”.

Manually lower all spools of the target head

unit to the lowest, or “blow position”.

n NOTE

Lower the spool to prevent the sudden high pressure blow

at Step 7.

Step 6 Lowering the spools 

Path Image Lowering the spools : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/Others/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_8_8.1_Lowering_spools.png

Step 7 Turn OFF the “head shaft blow” valve, and ON the “head vacuum switch” valve.

1. Referring to “Blow air path on RM head unit”

on the next page, check the head unit and

rod number to be blown.

2. Change to the [unit] > [I/O] tab screen, then

select “HEAD” in the “Output” pull-down list.

content:
2. Change to the [unit] > [I/O] tab screen, then

select “HEAD” in the “Output” pull-down list.

3. Confirm that the I/O column of “Z1 Blow

Valve” and “Z2 Blow Valve” of the head unit

checked in 1 above are both set to “0”.

4. Click on the I/O column for the “HEAD

SHAFT BLOW” of the target head unit.

Then turn OFF the head shaft blow valve by

pressing the [ON/OFF] button displayed at

the bottom of the screen.

(At this time, the column value changes

from 1 to 0.)

5. Turn ON the “HEAD VAC_SWITCH” for the

target head unit as the same procedure.

(At this time, the column value changes

from 0 to 1.)

	Path Image Turning head shaft blow OFF, head vacuum switch ON : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/Others/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_8_8.1_Turning_head_shaft_blow_OFF_head_vacuum_switch_ON.png

Blow air path on RM head unit

metadata.sub_section: 8.1|Cleaning Inside of Nozzle Shaft on RM Head Unit

content:
Blow air path on RM head unit

Viewing the RM head unit from the front, the air hose on the right side is called “Rod 1 air line” and the

one on the left side is called “Rod 2 air line”. When cleaning the inside of the nozzle shaft for the RM

head maintenance, check the head unit to be maintained, the worker's position, and the rod's position in

advance.

Positions of the head units and rods

Example: head unit B

Path Image Positions of the head units and rods : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/Others/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_8_8.1_Positions_head_units_and_rods.png

Step 8 Blow inside the shaft:

1. Raise the V-axis on the target rod side by finger and then the target spool raises and blows with high pressure

inside the nozzle shaft.

2. In the above state, push the Z-axis on the target rod side two or three times with finger to move the nozzle shaft just below the Z-axis vertically.

metadata.sub_section: 8.1|Cleaning Inside of Nozzle Shaft on RM Head Unit

content:
3. Hold the N-axis gear by hand and rotate the R-axis gear to rotate the nozzle shaft approximately 120 degrees.

4. In the above state, push the Z-axis on the target rod side two or three times with finger to move the nozzle

shaft just below the Z-axis vertically.

5. Perform the procedures 3 to 4 above again.

6. Lower the V-axis with finger to stop high pressure blow.

7. Rotate the rotary by rotating the N-axis and repeat the procedures 1 to 6 for all the heads.

High pressure blow inside of nozzle shaft

content:
Step 8-6

NOTE

It requires approx. 30 seconds to blow per head. If dirt cannot be removed, blow a little longer.

Step 9 Turn ON the “head shaft blow” valve, and OFF the “head vacuum switch” valve.

Follow the procedure of Step 7 to turn ON the

“head shaft blow” valve (the column value

changes from 0 to 1) and turn OFF the “head

vacuum switch” valve (the column value

changes from 1 to 0) for the cleaned head unit.

Step 10 Attach the filter.

1. Attach new filters to all heads referring to

“1.4.3 Replacing air Filters” above in this

chapter.

2. Remove the square cloth after completing

your work.

Step 11 Check the vacuum level.

Check the vacuum level without the nozzle and

filter.

• Vacuum level reference value: 130 or less

If the vacuum level is out of the value, perform

Steps 5 to 10 again for relevant nozzle shaft.

TIP

metadata.sub_section: 8.1|Cleaning Inside of Nozzle Shaft on RM Head Unit

content:
Steps 5 to 10 again for relevant nozzle shaft.

TIP

See “1.4.2 Checking for Filter Clogging” above in this

chapter for checking method of the vacuum level.

Step 12 Recover the spool position.

1. Close the machine safety cover and attach

the feeder exchange carriage.

2. Release the emergency stop.

3. Open the [unit] > [head] tab screen.

4. Select the table to perform the work.

5. Press the [Recover Valve Pos] button to

return the spools to the reset positions.

NOTE

The spool position after recovery is set to the vacuum

position.

8.2 How to Clean Nozzle ID Mark

If the following error occurs when reading a nozzle ID, the nozzle ID mark may be dirty.

In this case, clean the nozzle ID mark.

Ea13480: nozzle ID reading error

Path Image Ea13480: nozzle ID reading error : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/Others/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_8_8.2_Ea13480.png

Step 1 Detach all nozzles with dirty nozzle ID marks.

1. Open the [unit] > [head] tab screen.

2. Press the [nozzle Change] button.

3. On the “nozzle Change” screen, select “ALL”

for “head Number” and “Store nozzle” for

“nozzle Type”.

4. Press the [OK] button. The nozzles on all

heads will be stored into the nozzle station.

5. Press the emergency stop button and

detach the feeder exchange carriage.

Then open the machine safety cover.

6. Take all nozzles with dirty nozzle ID marks

out of the nozzle station.

Step 1 Detaching nozzles (for machine with nozzle station)

out of the nozzle station.

Step 1 Detaching nozzles (for machine with nozzle station)

Path Image Detaching nozzles (for machine with nozzle station) : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/Others/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_8_8.2_Detaching_nozzles.png

Step 2 Degrease the nozzle ID marks.

Using a cotton swab moistened with absolute

ethanol, rub the nozzle ID marks.

TIP

Use the optional cotton swab (KMB-M7960-00).

Step 2 Degreasing the nozzle ID marks 

Path Image Degreasing the nozzle ID marks : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/Others/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_8_8.2_Degreasing_nozzle_ID_marks.png

Step 3 Clean the nozzle ID marks.

Press the nozzle ID mark firmly and vertically

against the adhesive surface of the nozzle tip

cleaning tape (KGT-M8895-00) two or three

times to remove dirt.

CAUTION

If you rotate or tilt the nozzle while pressing it against

the nozzle tip cleaning tape, the adhesive surface of the

the nozzle tip cleaning tape, the adhesive surface of the

tape may stick to the nozzle ID mark.

Step 3 Cleaning the nozzle ID marks

Path Image Cleaning the nozzle ID marks : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/Others/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_8_8.2_Cleaning_nozzle_ID_marks.png

Path Image Before cleaning after cleaning : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/Others/Chapter_3_Periodic_Maintenance_Items_8_8.2_Before_After_Cleaning.png

Step 4 Clean the nozzle ID marks until the dirt is removed.

Repeat Steps 2 to 3 until the nozzle ID mark is clean.

1 Preparing to Lubricate

1.1 Compatible Grease

For greasing procedures, always use the YAMAHA prescribed grease shown below.

CAUTION

The grease specified by YAMAHA must be used for lubricating.

Using unauthorized grease could damage the machine.

| machine main unit | Lubrication point | Grease | Remarks |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Axes | X-axis | Guide | NSL grease | Using grease gun |
| Axes | X-axis | ball screw | NSL grease | Using grease gun |
| Axes | Y-axis | Guide | NSL grease | Using grease gun |
| Axes | W-axis (U-axis) | Guide | NSL grease | Using grease gun |
| Axes | W-axis (U-axis) | ball screw | NSL grease | Manual lubrication |
| Axes | W-axis (U-axis) | Hexagon spline | NSL grease | Manual lubrication |
| Axes | PU-axis | ball screw | NSL grease | Manual lubrication |

| Head unit | Lubrication point | Grease | Remarks |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| HM head unit | Spline shaft | NSL grease |   |
| RM head unit | Scissors gear | LG2 |   |
| RM head unit | Spool | Grease for spool | GREASE 30G |
| RM head unit | Upper part of nozzle shaft | Oil for upper part of shaft | LS bell hammer |
| FM head unit | ball screw | NSL grease |   |
| FM head unit | Guide | AFF grease |   |
| FM head unit | Spline shaft | LRL grease |   |
| LM head unit | ball screw | NSL grease |   |
| LM head unit | Guide | NSL grease |   |
| LM head unit | Scissors gear | LG2 |   |

| Other | Lubrication point | Grease | Remarks |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Feeder exchange  carriage | Upper cover, positioning unit,   carriage lift shaft | NSL grease |   |

1.2 Grease Gun

here are three types of the nozzle for the grease gun used for grease lubrication. The nozzle can be

changed depending on the lubrication point. Make sure to change the nozzle according to the lubrication

instructions.

Grease gun

Path Image Grease gun : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/Preparing_to_Lubricate/Chapter_4_Lubrication_Points_List_1_1.2_Grease_gun.png

CAUTION

Prepare a nozzle for each type of grease to be used.

Mixing greases with different characteristics may degrade the performance of the machine.

1 Nozzles

When the nozzle tip or O-ring is worn out due to long-term use, pick-up and placement errors are likely

to occur. If the spring action of a nozzle is not smooth even after cleaning and lubricating the nozzle, the

internal spring may need to be replaced.

metadata.chapter: 5|How to Replace Consumable and Maintenance Parts

content:
1.1 Replacing Spring and O-Ring

Step 1 Detach the nozzle.

1. Press the emergency stop button and

detach the feeder exchange carriage.

2. Open the machine safety cover.

3. Detach the relevant nozzle manually.

NOTE

On a machine equipped with a nozzle station, when

detaching the nozzles, make sure to store all nozzles to

the nozzle station automatically by pressing the [nozzle

Change] button on the [unit] > [head] tab screen.

Step 2 Replace the spring or O-ring.

1. Detach the O-ring from the nozzle.

2. Push out the pin of the nozzle.

3. Replace the spring.

4. Fix the nozzle tip and nozzle holder as one

with the pin.

5. Attach the O-ring. If it is loose or deformed,

replace it.

CAUTION

Be sure to combine the nozzle holder and nozzle tip with

the same ones used before disassembly. If they are

combined with different ones, the nozzle length may

change or its sliding condition may deteriorate, causing

mounting failure.

Step 2 Replacing the spring and O-ring

metadata.chapter: 5|How to Replace Consumable and Maintenance Parts

content:
mounting failure.

Step 2 Replacing the spring and O-ring

	Path Image Replacing the spring and O-ring : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/Nozzles/Chapter_5_How_to_Replace_Consumable_and_Maintenance_Parts_1_Replacing_spring_and_Oring.png

Step 3 Lubricate the spring action part.

Lubricate the nozzle spring action part referring

to “1.2.1 Cleaning and Lubricating Shaft Mating

Part and Spring Action Part” in Chapter 3.

NOTE

Oil-less nozzles do not need to be lubricated.

Step 4 Return the nozzles to their original positions.

Return the nozzles to the heads from which

they have been detached. If the nozzles have

been detached from the nozzle station, return

them to their original storage position.

metadata.chapter: 5|How to Replace Consumable and Maintenance Parts

content:

1. Press the emergency stop button and

detach the feeder exchange carriage.

Then open the machine safety cover.

2. Detach the relevant nozzle manually.

CAUTION

On a machine equipped with a nozzle station, when

detaching the nozzles, make sure to store all nozzles

into the nozzle station automatically by pressing the

[nozzle Change] button on the [unit] > [head] tab screen.

Step 2 Replace the O-ring.

Detach the O-ring and replace it with a new

one. If the O-ring is difficult to detach, use a

precision flathead screwdriver to detach it.

Step 3 Return the nozzle to its original position.

which it was detached.

2 Nozzle Leaf Springs and Roller Lock

When a problem is found after checking the nozzle leaf springs as described in “1.1.2 Condition Check of nozzle Leaf Spring and Roller Lock unit” in Chapter 3, replace the nozzle leaf springs or the roller lock.

CAUTION

If only the nozzle leaf spring or the roller lock on one side has deteriorated, it must be replaced as a pair.

metadata.chapter: 5|How to Replace Consumable and Maintenance Parts

content:
2.1 Replacing Nozzle Leaf Springs

The following describes how to replace the nozzle leaf spring (hereafter “leaf spring”).

metadata.chapter: 5|How to Replace Consumable and Maintenance Parts

content:
2.1.1 HM Head

Step 1 Detach the nozzle.

1. Press the emergency stop button and

detach the feeder exchange carriage.

2. Open the machine safety cover and move

the head unit to the position where

facilitates your work.

3. Place a square cloth beneath the head unit.

4. If a nozzle is attached to the head which

has a leaf spring to be replaced, detach the

nozzle manually.

NOTE

On a machine equipped with a nozzle station, when

detaching the nozzles, make sure to store all nozzles to

the nozzle station automatically by pressing the [nozzle Change] button on the [unit] > [head] tab screen.

Step 2 Detach the leaf springs.

Detach the leaf springs to be replaced by

removing fixing screw with a precision Phillips

screwdriver while holding the shaft.

CAUTION

Only remove the screw of the leaf spring.

Step 2 Detaching leaf spring

metadata.chapter: 5|How to Replace Consumable and Maintenance Parts

Step 3 Install the new leaf spring.

Install the new leaf spring by pressing it

upward and tightening the fixing screw with a precision Phillips screwdriver.

CAUTION

Always install both leaf springs so that they are parallel to the shaft.

2.3 RM Head: Replacing O-Ring of Nozzle Shaft Tip

Step 1 Prepare for work.

1. Remove all items sensitive to magnetic fields such as wristwatches and magnetic ID cards.

For a machine equipped with a nozzle station, store all the nozzles into it.

e 2. Press the emergency stop button and detach the feeder exchange carriage.

Then, open the machine safety cover.

3. Move the head unit by hand to the position convenient to work and place a square cloth under the head unit.

CAUTION

On a machine equipped with a nozzle station, when detaching the nozzles, make sure to store all nozzles into the

nozzle station automatically by pressing the [nozzle Change] button on the [unit] > [head] tab screen.

TIP

For details on how to lower the RM head nozzle shafts, see “1.4.1 How to Lower RM head nozzle Shafts” in Chapter 3.

NOTE

Remove the old O-ring on the shaft tip using the O-ring removal tool (KMX-M88JG-00), which is an optional purchase.
