Apply the grease dedicated for RM head

3 Conveyor Unit

3.1 Replacing Valves in Conveyor Unit

The position and number of valves driving the stopper or board clamp at the conveyor section vary

according to the machine specification or the board transfer direction.

Confirm the valve to be replaced by referring the figure below and the marked tubes attached to the valve

connector cables. The valve assembly is located at left and right side (conveyor entrance/exit) of conveyor.

TIP

There is no valve in the conveyor section of the Dual-lane type due to the different configuration of the conveyor. See “YRM20/YRM20DL Operator's Manual” for details.

3.2 How to Replace Valves

This section describes the procedure for the Dual-stage type as an example.

Step 1 Prepare for work.

1. Press the emergency stop button and detach the feeder exchange carriage.

2. Exit the software and power off the machine.

3. Turn the air supply/exhaust switch on the lower left of the machine clockwise (EXT).

4. Open the machine safety cover and detach off the upper cover.

Step 2 Detach the connector.

Detach the connector to be replaced.

NOTE

Confirm the valve to be replaced by checking the marked

tube attached to the connector cable.

Step 2 Detaching valve connector

	Path Image Detaching valve connector : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/Conveyor_Unit/Chapter_5_How_to_Replace_Consumable_and_Maintenance_Parts_3_3.2_Detaching_valve_connector.png

Step 3 Replace the valve.

1. Remove two fixing screws of the target

valve using a precision Phillips screwdriver.

2. Attach a new valve.

3. Connect the connector.

CAUTION

metadata.chapter: 5|How to Replace Consumable and Maintenance Parts

content:
2. Attach a new valve.

3. Connect the connector.

CAUTION

The packing is attached to the back of the valve.

Replace the valve with a new one while carefully

checking the packing for dropping or catching.

Step 3 Valve replacement

	Path Image Valve replacement : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/Conveyor_Unit/Chapter_5_How_to_Replace_Consumable_and_Maintenance_Parts_3_3.2_Valve_replacement.png

Step 4 Check the valve operation.

1. Attach the upper cover and close the

machine safety cover.

2. Turn on the air supply and machine power,

and attach the feeder exchange carriage.

3. Check the replaced valve operation on the

[unit] > [I/O] tab screen.

NOTE

The below figure is an example of the right-to-left flow on

a Dual-stage type machine. after replacing the valve,

confirm the actual address and operate the valve.

5 Cover

5.1 Replacing machine Safety Cover Absorber

The absorbers for the machine safety cover are located on the back of the machine safety cover. If the

machine safety cover closes forcefully without slowing down, follow the procedure below to replace the

absorber.

Step 1 Prepare for work.

1. Remove all items sensitive to magnetic

fields such as wristwatches and magnetic

ID cards.

2. Press the emergency stop button and

detach the feeder exchange carriage. Then,

open the machine safety cover.

Step 2 Pull out the absorber.

Pinch the rod of the absorber on the back of

the machine safety cover and pull out the

absorber upward.

Step 3 Insert a new absorber.

Insert a new absorber, taking care not to bend

its rod

Step 4 Check the insertion condition of the absorber.

Using a hand mirror, check that the inserted

absorber is touching the bottom of the holder.

Step 2, 3, 4 Replacing absorber and checking insertion state

Step 5 Check the position difference between the stay and absorber.

Close the machine safety cover and check that

the bottom of the stay and the top of the

absorber rod are aligned straight using a hand

mirror.

Step 6 Close the machine safety cover.

Close the machine safety cover and make sure it closes slowly.

1 Specifications

1.1 Air Regulator Unit

1.1.1 Supply Air Pressure

The air regulator for controlling the air pressure to the machine's pneumatic units is located at the lower

left panel on the front side of the YRM20/YRM20DL. Specify the appropriate air pressure setting shown

below.

air pressure regulator section

Path Image air pressure regulator section : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/Specifications/Appendix_1_1.1_1.1.1_Air_pressure_regulator_section.png

Supply air pressure

This is the pressure of the source air supplied to the machine. Before setting the air pressure with the

air regulator, make sure that this supply air pressure is in the following optimal range.

YRM20/YRM20DL: 0.45 MPa or more

air pressure gauge

When within the normal range, the air pressure displays in green. When the air pressure is beyond the

upper/lower limit values (air down detection), an error occurs, and the air pressure displays in red.

Set air pressure and air down detection

Set air pressure and air down detection

Set air pressure for main machine: 0.40 MPa (0.39 MPa to 0.41 MPa)

When it achieves 0.45 MPa, the air pressure gauge displays in red.

air down detection pressure: 	   0.33 MPa

air supply/shutoff switch (valve)

Turning this switch to the right shuts off air supply and exhausts air that remains inside the machine.

Source air connector

Prepare an air hose with an inner diameter of at least 8 mm having a 40SH socket (Nitto Koki, or

equivalent), and connect it to this connector. Use clean air passed through an air dryer and air filter.

1.2 Power Connection Terminals

The power connection terminals are located inside the front lower panel of the machine. Connect the power cables shown below to the primary side terminals L1, L2, L3 of main breaker and ground terminal on the main machine.

Power supply specifications

| Item | Specification | Remarks |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Power supply | 3-phase AC 200/208/220/240/380/400/416 V ±10% |   |
| Frequency | 50 / 60 Hz |   |
| Power capacity | 2-beam / 1-beam | 2.5 kVA (Peak 5.4 kVA) | Value of the main axis reaching to  the maximum speed |
| Power capacity | 2-beam (Dual-lane type) | 3.1 kVA (Peak 7.1 kVA) | Value of the main axis reaching to  the maximum speed |
| Breaker rating | 30 A | Value concerning the trans   magnetizing inrush current |
| Maximum current | 55 A | At 200V |
| Power consumption | 2-beam | 2.2 kW |   |
| Power consumption | 2-beam (Dual-lane type) | 2.7 kW |   |
| Power consumption | 1-beam | 1.2 kW |   |

Power connection terminals and cables

Front right lower part of machine

Path Image Power connection terminals and cables : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/Specifications/Appendix_1_1.2_Power_connection_terminals_and_cables.png

WARNING

TO AVOID THE RISK OF ELECTRICAL SHOCK, MAKE SURE THAT THE POWER SOURCE IS OFF BEFORE CONNECTING

THE POWER CABLE. ALSO MAKE SURE THAT THE GROUND CABLE IS SECURELY CONNECTED TO THE machine.

CAUTION

Use a power cable whose conductor cross-section area is greater than 6.0 mm2.

CAUTION

By referring to the figure above, be sure to connect the power cable correctly to the L1, L2 and L3 terminals on the power input terminal block so that they are in the normal phase. Incorrect connection may cause the vacuum pump to turn in the wrong direction and drastically damage to the components in the vacuum pump.

1.3 I/O Connectors

To exchange signals such as board request and operation status with the downstream or upstream

machine, the “NEXT INTERFACE” and “PREVIOUS INTERFACE” connectors located on the rear of the

machine are used.

The “NEXT INTERFACE” connector connects to the downstream machine, and the “PREVIOUS INTERFACE” connector connects to the upstream machine such as a loader.

At the standard “R to L” flow line, the PREVIOUS INTERFACE is located on the observer's left and the NEXT INTERFACE on the right.

Both connectors use AMP206043-1 (14 pin, receptacle).

I/O connectors

Example: Right-to-left flow

Path Image I/O connectors : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/Specifications/Appendix_1_1.3_I_O_connectors.png

1.3.1 PREVIOUS INTERFACE

When the following three conditions are met, the PREVIOUS INTERFACE circuit in the machine allows the next board to be carried in.

1. machine is ready for carrying in a board (BUSY OUT: ON)

2. board carry-in signal is input from the upstream (previous process) machine. (BA IN: ON)

3. Automatic operation signal is input from the upstream (previous process) machine. (UR IN: ON)

NOTE

• When the automatic operation signal (UR IN) from the loader turns off during transfer of a board, the machine temporarily

stops carrying in the board.

• When the board being carried in is detected by the entrance sensor of the machine, the BUSY OUT signal turns off.

• Carrying in the board is finished when both the BUSY OUT and BA IN turn off.

PREVIOUS INTERFACE circuit

Path Image PREVIOUS INTERFACE circuit : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/Specifications/Appendix_1_1.3_1.3.1_PREVIOUS_INTERFACE_circuit.png

board transfer signal specifications for PREVIOUS INTERFACE

| Pin No. | Signal name | I/O specifications | Signal specifications |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 1 | BUSY OUT | Relay contact (zero voltage) output | Signal output during board carry-in |
| 2 | BUSY OUT | Relay contact (zero voltage) output | Signal output during board carry-in |
| 3 | +24 V | Input common (+24 V) | Signal input of board carry-out request |
| 4 | BA IN | Voltage input | Signal input of board carry-out request |
| 5 | NC (with dummy pins) | (Prevents misinsertion) | – |
| 6 to 8 | NC | – | – |
| 9 | +24 V | Input common (+24 V) | Signal input during automatic operation |
| 10 | UR IN | Voltage input | Signal input during automatic operation |
| 11 | LR OUT | Relay contact (zero voltage) output | Signal output during automatic operation |
| 12 | LR OUT | Relay contact (zero voltage) output | Signal output during automatic operation |
| 13 | LE OUT | Relay contact (zero voltage) output | Signal output during waiting for board  between machines |
| 14 | LE OUT | Relay contact (zero voltage) output | Signal output during waiting for board  between machines |

1.3.2 NEXT INTERFACE

When the following three conditions are met, the NEXT INTERFACE circuit in the machine allows the board to be carried out.

1. machine is ready for carrying out the board (BA OUT: ON)

2. board carry-in signal is input from the downstream machine. (BUSY IN: ON)

3. Automatic operation signal is input from the downstream machine. (LR IN: ON)

NOTE

• When the automatic operation signal (LR IN) from the downstream machine turns off during transfer of a board,

the machine stops temporarily carrying out the PC.

• When the board being carried out is detected by the exit sensor of the machine, the BA OUT signal turns off.

• Carrying out the board is finished when both the BUSY IN and BA OUT turn off.

NEXT INTERFACE circuit

Path Image NEXT INTERFACE circuit: Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Maintenance_Manual/Specifications/Appendix_1_1.3_1.3.2_NEXT_INTERFACE_circuit.png

 board transfer signal specifications for NEXT INTERFACE

| Pin No. | Signal name | I/O specifications | Signal specifications |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 1 | +24 V | Input common (+24 V) | Signal input during board carry-in |
| 2 | BUSY IN | Voltage input | Signal input during board carry-in |
| 3 | BA OUT | Relay contact (zero voltage) output | Signal output to request board carry-out |
| 4 | BA OUT | Relay contact (zero voltage) output | Signal output to request board carry-out |
| 5 | NC | – | – |
| 6 | NC (with dummy pins) | (Prevents misinsertion) | – |
| 7 | GND | – | – |
| 8 | NC | – | – |
| 9 | UR OUT | Relay contact (zero voltage) output | Signal output during automatic operation |
| 10 | UR OUT | Relay contact (zero voltage) output | Signal output during automatic operation |
| 11 | +24 V | Input common (+24 V) | Signal input during automatic operation |
| 12 | LR IN | Voltage input | Signal input during automatic operation |
| 13 | +24 V | Input common (+24 V) | Signal input during waiting for board  between machines |
| 14 | LE IN | Voltage input | Signal input during waiting for board  between machines |

Serial No._______________     Inspection Check Sheet 1/2

This inspection check sheet describes from daily to monthly inspections.

Copy this page and use it for inspection.

Detail inspection procedures and inspections of 2-month interval or more

are described in each chapter of maintenance manual.

| Section | Unit name | Check items | Inspection/work | Weekly (Month/Day) | Monthly | Repair/  replacement |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Section | Unit name | Check items | Inspection/work | ノ | ノ | ノ | ノ | ノ | ノ | ノ |
| Head units | Common | Nozzle | Nozzle tip | Check nozzle tip visually. If not clean, remove dirt on component  pick-up surface (nozzle tip) using the nozzle tip cleaning tape that  comes with machine. |   |   |   |   |   | ノ |   |
| Head units | Common | Nozzle | Spring action | Press nozzle tip with finger to check the spring action. If not smooth,  disassemble and clean the nozzle and then apply grease. |   |   |   |   |   | ノ |   |
| Head units | Common | Nozzle | air path | Clean nozzle air path if vacuum level when nozzle is open is out of  standard value or once every month. Use air blow tool, nozzle  cleaning wire or similar tool. |   |   |   |   |   | ノ | ノ |
| Head units | HM, FM,   LM | Leaf springs  (Roller lock) | Nozzle attachment  conditions | Detach/attach a nozzle manually to check that the leaf springs (or  roller lock) have enough griping force. Check that leaf springs are  not deformed or worn out. If it is defective, replace it with a new one. |   |   |   |   |   | ノ |   |
| Head units | RM | Tip of nozzle shaft | air filter | Check the air filter for clogging. If the filter is dirty or the vacuum  level when the nozzle is open is not good, replace the filter. |   |   |   |   |   | ノ |   |
| X-axis and Y-axis | X-axis | ball screw | Clean the ball screw using a dry cloth. after that, apply the specified  grease (NSL) using a grease gun. Move the head unit to spread the  grease. | ノ | ノ | ノ | ノ | ノ |   | ノ |
| X-axis and Y-axis | X-axis | Guide | Clean the guide using dry cloth. after that, apply the specified grease  (NSL) using a grease gun. Move the head unit to spread the grease. | ノ | ノ | ノ | ノ | ノ |   | ノ |
| X-axis and Y-axis | Y-axis | Guide | Clean the guide using dry cloth. after that, apply the specified grease  (NSL) using a grease gun. Move the head unit to spread the grease. | ノ | ノ | ノ | ノ | ノ |   | ノ |
| X-axis and Y-axis | Y-axis | Linear scale | Check that old grease remains on the linear scale.
